definition: made in imitation of something else with intent to deceive : forged

examples: counterfeit joy at her friend's engagement

definition: to imitate or feign especially with intent to deceive, to make a fraudulent replica of
to try to deceive by pretense or dissembling
to engage in counterfeiting something of value

examples: The $20 bill turned out to be a counterfeit.

definition: something likely to be mistaken for something of higher value
examples: Pity was a counterfeit of love …
